Package elements

Class Car

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
elements.MovingImage
elements.Car
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Car
extends MovingImage
Used to create the 2D car the User will control to play the game. Uses a custom images that moves.
Version:
5/23/21
Author:
Alex Lan
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Car

      public Car​(processing.core.PImage img, int x, int y, int wid, int h)
      Car constructor. Also sets the friction, speed (default = 0), x and y velocity (default = 0), checkpoint number (default = 0), and boost (default = 3)
      Parameters:
      img - image file that the car will be using
      x - x-coordinate
      y - y-coordinate
      wid - width of the Car object
      h - height of the Car object

  • Method Details

    • accelerate

      public void accelerate()
      Accelerates the car by adding to the speed of the car

    • deaccelerate

      public void deaccelerate()
      Deaccelerates the car by subtracting to the speed of the car

    • boost

      public void boost()
      Boosts the car in the direction the car is facing

    • act

      public void act​(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> walls, Car c)
      Calculates the velocity of the car in the x and y direction based on the car's direction it is facing (in degrees), as well as the speed (based on how much the user accelerates). The friction to the ground is also calculated, as well as the collision with the wall objects. These all are then used to update the position of the car.
      Parameters:
      walls - ArrayList of walls that this Car object cannot pass through
      c - car that this Car object cannot pass through

    • getXVelocity

      public double getXVelocity()
      Gets the velocity of the car on the x axis
      Returns:
      the specified car object's x velocity

    • getYVelocity

      public double getYVelocity()
      Gets the velocity of the car on the y axis
      Returns:
      the specified car object's y velocity

    • getBoost

      public int getBoost()
      Returns the number of boosts the car has left
      Returns:
      number of boosts left (ranging from 0-3)

    • getCheckpoint

      public int getCheckpoint()
      Gets the checkpoint number stored in the Car Object
      Returns:
      the number correlated to the last checkpoint past/inputed into the car

    • setCheckpoint

      public void setCheckpoint​(int x)
      Changes the checkpoint number
      Parameters:
      x - value correlated to a checkpoint number
